meanings.definition: A small, slender, pointed piece of metal used in sewing.
meanings.sent1: Mom used a needle to sew a button on my shirt.
meanings.sent2: She carefully threaded the needle before starting to sew.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten played with the needle, thinking it was a toy.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like a needle, piercing through his heart.
meanings.sent5: The needle gleamed in the sunlight as she worked on her embroidery.

meanings.definition: A thin, pointed piece of metal used in medical procedures.
meanings.sent1: The doctor used a needle to give the patient an injection.
meanings.sent2: The nurse carefully disposed of the used needle in the sharps container.
meanings.sent3: The needle looked intimidating, but the nurse assured the child it wouldn't hurt.
meanings.sent4: His fear of needles made him avoid going to the doctor for years.
meanings.sent5: The acupuncture needle helped relieve her back pain.

meanings.sent1: She knew just how to needle her brother into confessing.
meanings.sent2: His constant teasing never failed to needle her patience.
meanings.sent3: The playful banter between friends was meant to needle each other in good fun.
meanings.sent4: Her sarcastic remarks seemed to needle him more than she intended.
meanings.sent5: The comedian's jokes were sharp, aiming to needle the audience into laughter.
